feels.name: Love
feels.quote: Fred was certainly very fond of his mother.

feels.name: Disappointment
feels.quote: He had been left an orphan when he was fresh from a public school.

feels.name: Hope
feels.quote: He was a quick fellow, and when hot from play, would toss himself in a corner, and in five minutes be deep in any sort of book that he could lay his hands on.

feels.name: Vexation
feels.quote: Mary did not mean to betray any feeling, but in spite of herself she ended in a tremulous tone of vexation.

feels.name: Affection
feels.quote: She doted on her eldest son and her youngest girl.

feels.name: Sarcasm
feels.quote: Mary was sewing swiftly, and seemed provokingly mistress of the situation.

feels.name: Intellectual passion
feels.quote: From that hour Lydgate felt the growth of an intellectual passion.

feels.name: Curiosity
feels.quote: He was a quick fellow, and when hot from play, would toss himself in a corner, and in five minutes be deep in any sort of book that he could lay his hands on.

feels.name: Hope
feels.quote: He was but seven-and-twenty, an age at which many men are not quite commonâ€”at which they are hopeful of achievement.

Places.name: Home
Places.description: The setting where the characters experience various emotions and events.
